DOC.brief_summary: Previous studies have highlighted the potential therapeutic benefits of receptive individual music therapy as an adjunct to standard care, in a variety of psychiatric ailments including mood and anxiety disorders. However, the role of music in the treatment of obsessive compulsive disorder have not been investigated to date. The present study therefore aimed to investigate the efficacy of music therapy as an adjunct to standard treatment, on obsessions in patients with treatment-na√Øve OCD. Moreover, given the fact that a significant proportion of patients with OCD have other comorbid mood or anxiety disorders, the question of whether therapeutic benefits of music could be expanded to also affect concurrent depressive and anxiety symptoms was explored.
DOC.brief_title: Music Therapy in Obsessive Compulsive Disorder
DOC.criteria: were at least 18 years or older; had axis I diagnosis of OCD according to the criteria delineated by the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders fourth edition diagnosed by an experienced psychiatrist had not received treatment previously for the disorder agreed to partake in the study refused to partake in the study
